marklogic.body: Agreed theirs no doubt Cena is a legend, his contributions are huge. He's the Hulk Hogan of this absolutely, but why is that a bad thing? And anyone who say's Cena is a bad wrestler watch his matches with Jericho, Edge, Punk, Orton, Rob Van Dam, Triple H, Shawn Michaels, Kurt Angle, and even Umanga and The Great Khali, and say he's a bad wrestler. It's true Cena has nothing left to do really just like guys such as The Rock, Stone Cold Steve Austin, The Undertaker. Triple H, Shawn Michaels, Chris Jericho, Sting, Hulk Hogan, Kurt Angle, Bret Hart etc John Cena is one of the best, as is Randy Orton, All of these careers I've mentioned are Hall of fame worthy.
